sentence.Network_en: I may be an old codger, but I've sharp ears.
sentence.Network_cn: 别看我门神老了不捉鬼, 我耳朵可灵着哩.

sentence.Network_en: Bald head over the blind, cute old codger.
sentence.Network_cn: 遮篷上端露出个秃头, 那是个精明而有怪癖的老头子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: perhaps a variant of cadger (see cadge)

entry.def: Old codger is a disrespectful way of referring to an old man.

means.word_mean: 1. used affectionately to refer to an eccentric but amusing old man

auth_sentence.content: He's an irascible old codger, and usually spot on in his pronouncements.
auth_sentence.res_content: He's an irascible old codger, and usually spot on in his pronouncements.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He's an irascible old codger, and usually spot on in his pronouncements.

auth_sentence.content: Were we really supposed to root for Jay, a wealthy codger grumbling at his trophy wife, Gloria?
